name: Adonis
description: Once a regular drink at the Old Waldorf-Astoria Bar during the late 19th and early 20th centuries, the Adonis was named for a popular 1884 musical that was the Mamma Mia of its era. A simple combination of dry sherry and sweet vermouth, the Adonis is a great introduction to the realm of aperitif cocktails.

recipeInstructions.text: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir well for 20 seconds, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Twist a piece of orange peel over the drink and use as garnish.
